data.event: The county was established on October 19, 1829 and named after John C. Calhoun, who was at the time Vice President under Andrew Jackson, making it one of Michigan's Cabinet counties.
The 2010 United States Census indicates Calhoun County had a 2010 population of 136,146.

event.title: a decrease of -1,839 people from the 2000

data.event: This is a decrease of -1,839 people from the 2000 United States Census.
